result.execSummary:
The defendant Tisha Monique Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $106.55 payable to Badger Care.

Court ordered defendant to pay All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 9-19-2017, failure to pay will result in civil judgment. 
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Concurrent with: with 129 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence, with Huber and Day Reporting Center privileges.
Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Tisha Monique Gardner in court with attorney Alex Flynn.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 129 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence, with Huber and Day Reporting Center privileges.

Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample.

16RM040252  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/27/2016

**CASE HEARD BY BR. 33 for Br. 22**

**NO COURT FILE IN COURT**

Defendant Tisha Monique Gardner in court with attorney Alex Flynn.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Prior to matter being called on the Record,  case was Staffed in Chambers.  Matter before the Court to address JusticePoint Violation Report.  Hearing proceeded on the Record.  After examination,  Court found that Defendant does NOT wish to challenge the positive test.  State moved to REMAND the Defendant.  State advised that the new violation reflects that Defendant would have used WHILE IN CUSTODY.  Defense advised that it is 'curious' that Defendant tested positive as Defendant was in Custody during the period of time in which Defendant would have had to have used.  Defense advised that since Bond was REVOKED in January that the conditions of Bail are no longer relevant.  Court ADMONISHED the Defendant.  Court REAFFIRMED THE ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY condition that was set at the 07-27-2016 Bail hearing.  COURT TOOK THE MOTION TO FORFEIT BAIL/REMAND UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TIME.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 22 for Bail/Bond Review.  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services Violation Report.  Filed, sdg.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests scheduling date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.
Notice of appearance received and filed.

Defendant Tisha Monique Gardner in court with attorney Alex Flynn.  Katherine Seelow for Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney Flynn for attorney Pecora. Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Counsel received and filed.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant has privately retained Attorney Alex Flynn, he cannot attend the return on warrant hearing on 07/29/2016 at 8:30am, case is moved to 07/27/2016 at 8:30am in Branch 22.
Defendant missed court on 01/05/2016.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 07/29/2016 at 8:30am, in Branch 22.  Parties notified.

Attorney Mark A. Pecora in court.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court previously ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Tisha Monique Gardner in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Defendant Tisha Monique Gardner in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Positive drug test.  Before the court could address the violation the defendant absconded. Court will address at next court date.

Defendant Tisha Monique Gardner in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Epps informs court that the defendant wishes to file a motion to withdraw her guilty plea.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in BRanch 22.  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tisha Monique Gardner in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing Memorandum received and filed.
Filed, Justice Point Report dated 9/16/2015.

Attorney Epps is going to try and contact a pair Judge to hear the return on warrant, as the earliest Branch 3 is able to address this matter is 07/27/2015 at 8:30.  If this matter is not addressed prior to then, the case will be set for a return on warrant in Branch 3 on 07/27/2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Tisha Monique Gardner in court with attorney Steve Sargent for Louis Edward Epps.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Enrique Carlton-DEA Special Agent.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tisha Monique Gardner in court.  Ronald Dague for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Attorney Epps did not appear or contact the Court for today's proceedings.  State Public Defender's Office contacted the Court to inform the Court that Attorney Epps was in trial in another court and that someone should be appearing on behalf of Attorney Epps, no Attorney appeared or contacted the Court. Per Commissioner Phillips, case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.Preliminary Hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.
